sentences.en: a steep climb to the top
Both he and the crew are on a steep learning curve.
sentences.cn: 他和组员们都学得很快。

sentences.en: She started once again on the steep upward climb.
sentences.cn: 她又开始沿着陡峭的山路往上爬。

sentences.en: The car slid down the steep gradient into the river.
sentences.cn: 汽车滑下陡峭的斜坡掉入河中.

sentences.en: The children clambered up the steep bank.
sentences.cn: 孩子们攀登上了陡峭的河岸。

sentences.en: The hotel was perched precariously on a steep hillside.
sentences.cn: 旅馆危险地坐落在陡峭的山坡上.

sentences.en: The men had to slog up a steep muddy incline.
sentences.cn: 人们只得在陡峭而泥泞的斜坡上艰难地行进。

sentences.en: The mountains reared up on each side, steep and white.
sentences.cn: 两边的山峦高耸入云，山势陡峭，覆盖着积雪。

sentences.en: The Newton Hotel is halfway up a steep hill.
sentences.cn: 丽东酒店位于陡峭的半山腰上。

sentences.en: The primroses should begin to seed themselves down the steep hillside.
sentences.cn: 报春花应该开始沿着陡峭的山坡一路撒播种子了。

sentences.en: The road became rocky and steep.
The slope is too steep for us to climb.
sentences.cn: 这斜坡太陡,我们爬不上去.

sentences.en: The steep, stony ground is well drained.
sentences.cn: 陡峭的石头地面排水性能很好。

sentences.en: The trail was steep and thick with underbrush.
sentences.cn: 那条小路非常陡峭，而且长满了灌木丛。

sentences.en: They climbed upward along the steep cliffs surrounding the village.
sentences.cn: 他们沿着村庄周围的陡峭悬崖往上爬。

sentences.en: We drove up a steep-sided valley.
sentences.cn: 我们沿着陡峭的峡谷向上开。

sentences.en: You have to shift down when you climb up steep hills.
sentences.cn: 开车爬陡峭的山坡时,你得换低速挡.

words.tran_cn: 陡峭的；不合理的；夸大的；急剧升降的

trans.tran_cn: 陡峭的，突然的，急剧的，过分的
trans.tran_en: a road, hill etc that is steep slopes at a high angle
to put food in a liquid and leave it there, so that it becomes soft or has the same taste as the liquid, or so that it gives the liquid its taste
